{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Banana Pi BPI M2 Berry.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = Open-Source Development Board |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = http://www.banana-pi.org/m2ub.html |sp = http://wiki.banana-pi.org/Banana_Pi_BPI-M2_Berry |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = Banana_Pi_BPI_M2_Berry |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = Supported |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Banana Pi |model = BPI M2 |submodelappend = yes |submodel = Berry |revision = v1.0 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = May 24, 2019 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Banana_Pi_BPI_M2_Berry |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = single-board computer |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Allwinner;V40; |cpu1_cores = 4 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A7 |cpu1spd = 1.2 GHz <!-- undocumented --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 0 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = DDR3 |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = 733MHz |ram1size = 1 GiB |ram1chip = Samsung;KB4G1646D-BCK0; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Realtek;RTL8211E; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 22:3b:09 |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;2014.07;; |stockos = Linux;3.10.107;;
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0, SATA 2, |exp_usb_num = 4 |exp_sata_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = USB Female Micro-B |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, 3.3V TTL,, 3-pin header,, populated,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Micro SD Card slot, HDMI 1.4, MIPI DSI, CSI, Bluetooth 4.0, 3.5mm TRRS, GPIO, I2C, I2S, SPI, |addchip = PMIC;X-Powers Limited;AXP221S;;1;,,, USB 2.0 High Speed 4-Port Hub Controller;JFD;FE1.1s;;1;,,, |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = pi |defaultpass = bananapi |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Android 6.0, Armbian, OpenWrt
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 05/2017 |estprice = 32 |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0773LHPKD |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = AMPAK AP6212 |rad1modif = SDIO/UART |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43430; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = integrated |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Specifications=== :'''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry''' Board *CPU: [[Allwinner]] V40 Quad-core (ARM Cortex-A7) H.265/HEVC *GPU: Mali-400 MP2 @500MHz, Supports OpenGL ES 2.0 *Memory: 1GB DDR3 @733MHz (shared with GPU) *WiFi & BT: [[AMPAK]] AP6212, BT 4.0, SDIO *Video Input: A CSI input connector :Camera: Supports 8-bit YUV422 CMOS sensor interface, :Supports CCIR656 protocol for NTSC and PAL, :Supports 5M pixel camera sensor, :Supports video capture solution up to 1080p @30fps *Video Outputs: Supports HDMI v1.4 or 4-channel MIPI DSI *Audio Outputs: HDMI or analog via 3.5mm TRSS *Power: 5V/2A via Micro USB *USB 2.0 ports: 4 USB 2.0 host and one USB 2.0 OTG *GPIO: 40x pins header, compatible with Raspberry Pi B+ *LED: Power led & Status led *OS: Android, Ubuntu, Raspberry Pi Image
==Links of Interest== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banana_Pi#Banana_Pi_BPI-M2_Berry ''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[http://wiki.banana-pi.org/Banana_Pi_BPI-M2_Berry ''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry'' on '''Banana Pi''' Wiki] *[http://linux-sunxi.org/Sinovoip_Banana_Pi_M2_Berry ''Sinovoip Banana Pi M2 Berry'' on '''Sunxi''' Wiki]
===News=== *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2017/05/29/banana-pi-bpi-m2-berry-allwinner-v40-development-board-allwinner-business-units-sdksoftware-management/ ''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry Allwinner V40 Development Board, Allwinner Business Units & SDK/Software Management'' on '''CNX-Software'''] *[http://linuxgizmos.com/latest-banana-pi-offers-sata-support-for-32/ ''Latest quad-core Banana Pi offers SATA support at $32'' on '''LinuxGizmos'''] *[https://www.elektormagazine.com/news/review-banana-pi-bpi-m2-berry ''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry'' on '''elektor Magazine'''] *[https://www.hackster.io/bananapi/banana-pi-bpi-m2-berry-quad-core-single-board-computer-fdd118 ''Banana Pi BPI-M2 Berry Quad Core Single-board Computer'' on '''Hackster''']
